body.directions: Listen to the audio; then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 衣柜 yīguì (dressing table/dresser)

body.quiz: Which of the following items do you most likely find in the furniture item indicated by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Excellently done! 衣柜 yīguì means “dressing table/dresser.” You can most likely find pants there, but maybe not chopsticks, oranges, or a house—even though they all share the same character 子 zi.
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again to identify its meaning. Then, identify the meanings of the words in the choices to see which one you can most likely find in the furniture mentioned in the audio.

body.quiz: For which of the following actions do you least likely need the furniture item said in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 听 tīng (to listen to)
options: Audio for 画 huà (to draw; drawing/picture)
Audio for 读 dú (to read)
Audio for 写 xiě (to write)
body.correct: Very nicely done! 灯 dēng means “lamp,” and you are least likely to use it when you are listening to something such as music.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word again to understand what furniture item it refers to. Then, consider which action in the choices you can accomplish without the item.

body.quiz: Which of the following words does not contain the same initial as the first character in the word in the audio?
body.correct: Excellently done! The first character in 衣服 yīfu (clothes) has the initial “y,” which is not in the word 枕头 zhěntóu (pillow).
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word again to identify the initial in its first character. Then, sound out the words in the choices to see which one does not have that initial.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 他在卧室_____衣服。Tā zài wòshì _____ yīfu.
options: 我在学校_____体育课。Wǒ zài xuéxiào _____ tǐyùkè.
我妹妹在阳台_____唱歌。Wǒ mèimei zài yángtái _____ chànggē.
她哥哥在秋天_____生日。Tā gēge zài qiūtiān _____ shēngrì.
body.correct: Outstanding job! 叠 dié means “to fold,” and it suits the sentence “他在卧室叠衣服。Tā zài wòshì dié yīfu. (He is folding clothes in the bedroom.)”
body.incorrect: Oops…listen to the audio one more time to identify the meaning of the verb. Then, place it in each of the sentences in the choices to see which one makes the most sense.
